short_term: Continue to struggle with coding assignments but gradually improve as coursework becomes more familiar.
Seek out additional resources or tutoring to enhance coding skills.
long_term: Develop a stronger foundation in computer science and programming, potentially leading to internships or part-time tech jobs.
Begin to apply learned skills in practical settings, possibly through projects or hackathons.

short_term: Slowly expand social circle, finding like-minded peers in classes or through clubs.
Experience growing pains in social interactions but start to feel more at ease in the college environment.
long_term: Form long-lasting friendships and potentially romantic relationships, contributing to a sense of belonging.
Develop social skills that will be beneficial in professional and personal life.

short_term: Implement small changes to sleep schedule and homework management to alleviate immediate stress.
Explore stress-relief techniques like meditation or yoga to manage college life stress.
long_term: Establish a sustainable routine that balances academic demands with personal health.
Gain resilience in managing stress and improve overall well-being through consistent lifestyle choices.

short_term: Start creating and adhering to a budget to manage college expenses more effectively.
Look for on-campus or part-time jobs to increase financial independence.
long_term: Develop financial literacy and independence, potentially saving or investing small amounts.
By graduation, achieve a level of financial stability that supports post-college plans.

short_term: Continue existential exploration through discussions with peers or philosophical readings.
Work on defining personal values and authenticity through reflective practices.
long_term: Integrate philosophical insights into personal and professional life, shaping a unique identity.
Achieve a deeper understanding of self and purpose, influencing career and life choices.

short_term: Overcome current coding challenges with dedicated practice and perhaps seeking help from peers or online resources.
Begin to see improvements in understanding and applying computer science concepts.
long_term: Become proficient in several programming languages and frameworks, preparing for tech-related career paths.
Leverage technology for personal projects or innovations, possibly leading to entrepreneurial ventures or contributions to open-source communities.
